meanings.sent1: After the rain canceled the picnic, they reslated it for next weekend.
meanings.sent2: She reslated the meeting for tomorrow since many couldn't attend today.
meanings.sent3: The cat reslated its nap time after being interrupted by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The teacher reslated the test date, giving students more time to study.
meanings.sent5: He reslated his workout routine to include more cardio exercises.

meanings.definition: To put back on a list or schedule
meanings.sent1: The librarian reslated the returned books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: They reslated the event after realizing they had forgotten to include it.
meanings.sent3: The chef reslated the dessert on the menu after receiving positive feedback.
meanings.sent4: She reslated the task on her to-do list to ensure it wouldn't be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The manager reslated the project for the following week to allocate more resources.
